intro: Blepharis gerlindae, commonly known as the Gerlindae wireweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are usually pale blue to purple in color and bloom during the summer months. Blepharis gerlindae is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
